greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of n^(n-1)/n!.
comment: (-1)^(n+1)* n-th numerator of coefficient in LambertW(x) power series, where LambertW(x) is the transcendental function satisfying LambertW(x)*exp( LambertW(x) )=x. - _Benoit Cloitre_, May 08 2002
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..250
mathematica: CoefficientList[-LambertW[-x]/x + O[x]^21, x] // Numerator (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 15 2019 *)
program: (Sage) [numerator(n^(n-1)/factorial(n)) for n in (1..30)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 08 2019
xref: A095996 is a better version of the denominators of the LambertW function. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 08 2021
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
